greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n-2 + Sum_{i = 1..n-2} (a(i+1) mod a(i)) for n >= 3 with a(1) = a(2) = 1.
comment: Essentially triangular numbers + 2, but with three extra initial terms.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Guo-Niu Han, Enumeration of Standard Puzzles, 2011. [Cached copy]
Guo-Niu Han, Enumeration of Standard Puzzles, arXiv:2006.14070 [math.CO], 2020.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3,1).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..2} A007318(n-k-2, k) for n > 3. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Aug 11 2013
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
